lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The essay ''On the Eve of 2001'' contained a persistent and troubling confusion. It was not anthropologists who, in the 60's, subscribed to a war-is-inevitable view of history. This idea was popularized by several nonanthropological books including ''The Naked Ape,'' by the zoologist Desmond Morris and ''African Genesis'' by the playwright Robert Ardrey.
abstract: Jack Bernhardt letter on Dec 26 article on predictions of film 2001: A Space Odyssey holds nonanthropological books popularized war-is-inevitable view, not anthropologists
